Body:
Because there exists a word "laugh" but "*daugh", while the forms are alike to each other.

I can't find the function of the morpheme "-ter" here, which is maybe irrelevant to the "-ter" in "enter" or "utter", which are a comparative suffix( from PIE *-tero) and a frequentative suffix "-er"( of unknown origin to me) respectively.
Title: What is the function of "-ter" in words "laughter" and "daughter"?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
